FuncDef:
The multicast extranet traffic-forward type command configures the extranet to forward multicast traffic through the specified interfaces.
The undo multicast extranet traffic-forward type command disables the extranet from forwarding multicast traffic through a specified interface.
By default, the extranet is disabled from forwarding multicast traffic through a specified interface.
CLIs: multicast extranet traffic-forward type { vlanif | qinq | bas igmp | vbdif }
undo multicast extranet traffic-forward type { vlanif | qinq | bas igmp | vbdif }

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates multicast traffic forwarding through a VLANIF interface.
-

Indicates multicast traffic forwarding through a QinQ/dot1q VLAN tag termination sub-interface.
-

Indicates multicast traffic forwarding through a BAS interface accessed.
In VS mode, this parameter is supported only by the admin VS.
-

Indicates IGMP users.
In VS mode, this parameter is supported only by the admin VS.
-

Indicates multicast traffic forwarding through a VBDIF interface.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In an MVPN extranet scenario, if users join a multicast group on a VLANIF interface, QinQ/dot1q VLAN tag termination sub-interface or BAS interface or VBDIF interface, the multicast device does not deliver entries to the forwarding table. As a result, the users cannot receive multicast traffic. To resolve this problem, run the multicast extranet traffic-forward type command to configure the extranet to forward multicast traffic through a VLANIF interface,QinQ/dot1q VLAN tag termination sub-interface or BAS interface or VBDIF interface,After that, the multicast device delivers entries to the forwarding table, and the users can receive multicast traffic.
